New Records: Tarik Skubal achieved his 16th win of the season, the most in baseball.
His ERA dropped to 2.51, the lowest in MLB.
He recorded 203 strikeouts, the highest in baseball.
Key Match Events: Detroit Tigers won the game 2-1 against the Boston Red Sox.
Tarik Skubal pitched eight innings, allowing only four hits, no walks, and eight strikeouts.
The Tigers scored their runs on a two-run double by Trey Sweeney in the seventh inning.
Pre-Game Insights: The Tigers are attempting to make up ground in the American League wild card race.
Skubal has been a consistent performer, stepping up with key performances.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager AJ Hinch opted not to have Skubal pitch the ninth inning, trusting Tyler Holton to close the game.
Skubal's performance has solidified his Cy Young Award chances and put him in contention for MVP.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Tigers are now only a half-game behind the Boston Red Sox if they win their next game.
The upcoming game's starter is uncertain for both teams.
Others: The article highlights Skubal's dominance and compares his achievements to historical records like Johan Santana's Triple Crown in 2006.
